alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 2:26AM PST until December 24 at 4:15AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 530 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oceanside, Carlsbad, Vista, Encinitas, Poway, Ramona, Valley Center, Fallbrook, Camp Pendleton, Escondido, San Marcos, Solana Beach, San Pasqual, Rancho Santa Fe, Camp Pendleton North, Camp Pendleton South, S7 - East Grade Rd and Hwy 79 Between Oak Grove And Aguanga. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
